doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
creation: 1820; alteration: 1827; alteration: 1829; alteration: 1865; alteration: 1868; alteration: 10 Jan 1882; alteration: 1882

Marchants cotton mill, plaster mill, saw mill, grist mill, dye shop, blacksmith shop, and brass foundry--1887 won a competition to supply fabrics for 1,000 uniforms for Philadelphia mail carriers--1892 chosen by Chicago Worlds Fair Commission to supply fabrics for 1,500 guard uniforms--Thomas L Farish Mill 1846--Charlottesville Factory : partnership of William P Farish, Henry W Jones, & John T Randolph Late 1840s--John Adams Marchant Mill 1852--Henry Clay Marchant Mill 1864--Owned by William Douglas Meriwether 1761-1845, then son William Hunter Meriwether b. 1793 was involved with the mill prior to going the Texas where he built a large mill
4 Story Brick Mill: 60'x120,' Tower with Mansard Roof, Segmental Arched Windows; School, Store, Chapel, Workers Houses, Supervisors House, Mill Dam
Saw mill w/3 cotton carding machines--Toll bridge built over Moores Creek built--Dam built--Burned in Civil War--Rebuilt--Burned--Rebuilt--Razed
